Montel's theorem, normal families, Urysohn subsequence principle

Let FFF be a function from D\DD to D\DD such that whenever z1,z2,z3z_1, z_2, z_3z1​,z2​,z3​ are distinct points of D\DD there exists an analytic function fz1,z2,z3f_{z_1,z_2,z_3}fz1​,z2​,z3​​ from D\DD to D\DD such that F(zj)=fz1,z2,z3(zj)F\p{z_j} = f_{z_1,z_2,z_3}\p{z_j}F(zj​)=fz1​,z2​,z3​​(zj​). Prove that FFF is analytic at every point of D\DD.

Hint: Fix z∈Dz \in \Dz∈D and let D∋zn→z\D \ni z_n \to zD∋zn​→z, zn≠zz_n \neq zzn​=z. Show that the sequence

F(zn)−F(z)zn−z\frac{F\p{z_n} - F\p{z}}{z_n - z}zn​−zF(zn​)−F(z)​

is bounded and prove that every two of its convergent subsequences have the same limit.
Solution.

Let 0<R<10 < R < 10<R<1, and let K=B(0,R)‾K = \cl{B\p{0, R}}K=B(0,R)​, which is a convex compact subset of D\DD. We will show that

sup⁡z,w∈K;z≠w∣F(z)−F(w)z−w∣<∞.\sup_{z,w \in K; z \neq w} \abs{\frac{F\p{z} - F\p{w}}{z - w}} < \infty.z,w∈K;z=wsup​∣∣​z−wF(z)−F(w)​∣∣​<∞.

Observe that {fz1,z2,z3∣z1,z2,z3∈D}\set{f_{z_1,z_2,z_3} \mid z_1, z_2, z_3 \in \D}{fz1​,z2​,z3​​∣z1​,z2​,z3​∈D} is uniformly bounded by 111, since their image lies in the unit disk. Thus, {fz1,z2,z3′∣z1,z2,z3∈D}\set{f_{z_1,z_2,z_3}' \mid z_1, z_2, z_3 \in \D}{fz1​,z2​,z3​′​∣z1​,z2​,z3​∈D} is also uniformly bounded: by Cauchy's integral formula,

∣fz1,z2,z3′(z)∣≤12π∫∂K∣fz1,z2,z3(ζ)(ζ−z)2∣ ds≤sup⁡z1,z2,z3∈D ∥fz1,z2,z3∥L∞(D)R≤1R.\abs{f_{z_1,z_2,z_3}'\p{z}} \leq \frac{1}{2\pi} \int_{\partial K} \abs{\frac{f_{z_1,z_2,z_3}\p{\zeta}}{\p{\zeta - z}^2}} \,\diff{s} \leq \sup_{z_1,z_2,z_3\in\D}\,\frac{\norm{f_{z_1,z_2,z_3}}_{L^\infty\p{\D}}}{R} \leq \frac{1}{R}.∣∣​fz1​,z2​,z3​′​(z)∣∣​≤2π1​∫∂K​∣∣​(ζ−z)2fz1​,z2​,z3​​(ζ)​∣∣​ds≤z1​,z2​,z3​∈Dsup​R∥fz1​,z2​,z3​​∥L∞(D)​​≤R1​.

Thus, for distinct z,w∈Kz, w \in Kz,w∈K,

∣F(z)−F(w)∣=∣fz,w,z3(z)−f(w)z,w,z3∣≤∫zw∣fz,w,z3′(ζ)∣ ds≤∣z−w∣1R  ⟹  ∣F(z)−F(w)z−w∣≤1R,\begin{aligned} \abs{F\p{z} - F\p{w}} &= \abs{f_{z,w,z_3}\p{z} - f\p{w}_{z,w,z_3}} \\ &\leq \int_z^w \abs{f_{z,w,z_3}'\p{\zeta}} \,\diff{s} \\ &\leq \frac{\abs{z - w}}{1}{R} \\ \implies \abs{\frac{F\p{z} - F\p{w}}{z - w}} & \leq \frac{1}{R}, \end{aligned}∣F(z)−F(w)∣⟹∣∣​z−wF(z)−F(w)​∣∣​​=∣fz,w,z3​​(z)−f(w)z,w,z3​​∣≤∫zw​∣∣​fz,w,z3​′​(ζ)∣∣​ds≤1∣z−w∣​R≤R1​,​

where we integrated along the segment from zzz to www.

Fix z∈Dz \in \Dz∈D. Since ∣z∣<1\abs{z} < 1∣z∣<1, we may pick ∣z∣<R<1\abs{z} < R < 1∣z∣<R<1, which means that F(ζ)−F(z)ζ−z\frac{F\p{\zeta} - F\p{z}}{\zeta - z}ζ−zF(ζ)−F(z)​ is bounded above by 1R\frac{1}{R}R1​. We will show that if {zn}n,{wn}n⊆D∖{z}\set{z_n}_n, \set{w_n}_n \subseteq \D \setminus \set{z}{zn​}n​,{wn​}n​⊆D∖{z} are sequences which converge to zzz and such that both

{F(zn)−F(z)zn−z}nand{F(wn)−F(z)wn−z}n\set{\frac{F\p{z_n} - F\p{z}}{z_n - z}}_n \quad\text{and}\quad \set{\frac{F\p{w_n} - F\p{z}}{w_n - z}}_n{zn​−zF(zn​)−F(z)​}n​and{wn​−zF(wn​)−F(z)​}n​

converge, then they converge to the same limit. For n≥1n \geq 1n≥1, let gn=fzn,wn,zg_n = f_{z_n,w_n,z}gn​=fzn​,wn​,z​ and observe that

F(zn)−F(z)zn−z=gn(zn)−gn(z)zn−zandF(wn)−F(z)wn−z=gn(wn)−gn(z)wn−z.(1)\tag{1} \frac{F\p{z_n} - F\p{z}}{z_n - z} = \frac{g_n\p{z_n} - g_n\p{z}}{z_n - z} \quad\text{and}\quad \frac{F\p{w_n} - F\p{z}}{w_n - z} = \frac{g_n\p{w_n} - g_n\p{z}}{w_n - z}.zn​−zF(zn​)−F(z)​=zn​−zgn​(zn​)−gn​(z)​andwn​−zF(wn​)−F(z)​=wn​−zgn​(wn​)−gn​(z)​.(1)

Notice that {gn}n\set{g_n}_n{gn​}n​ is uniformly bounded by 111, so it admits a locally uniformly convergent subsequence {gnk}k\set{g_{n_k}}_k{gnk​​}k​, which converges to some ggg. Let ε>0\epsilon > 0ε>0. By locally uniform convergence, ggg is also holomorphic, so there exists δ>0\delta > 0δ>0 such that if ∣ζ−z∣<δ\abs{\zeta - z} < \delta∣ζ−z∣<δ, then

∣g(ζ)−g(z)ζ−z−g′(z)∣<ε.(2)\tag{2} \abs{\frac{g\p{\zeta} - g\p{z}}{\zeta - z} - g'\p{z}} < \epsilon.∣∣​ζ−zg(ζ)−g(z)​−g′(z)∣∣​<ε.(2)

Similarly, by uniform convergence on KKK, there exists N∈NN \in \NN∈N such that if k≥Nk \geq Nk≥N, then

∣gnk(ζ)−gnk(η)ζ−η−g(ζ)−g(η)ζ−η∣<ε(3)\tag{3} \abs{\frac{g_{n_k}\p{\zeta} - g_{n_k}\p{\eta}}{\zeta - \eta} - \frac{g\p{\zeta} - g\p{\eta}}{\zeta - \eta}} < \epsilon∣∣​ζ−ηgnk​​(ζ)−gnk​​(η)​−ζ−ηg(ζ)−g(η)​∣∣​<ε(3)

for any distinct ζ,η∈K\zeta, \eta \in Kζ,η∈K. Thus, for kkk large enough, ∣znk−z∣,∣wnk−z∣<δ\abs{z_{n_k} - z}, \abs{w_{n_k} - z} < \delta∣znk​​−z∣,∣wnk​​−z∣<δ and we get

∣F(znk)−F(z)znk−z−F(wnk)−F(z)wnk−z∣=∣gnk(znk)−gnk(z)znk−z−gnk(wnk)−gnk(z)wnk−z∣(by (1))≤∣gnk(znk)−gnk(z)znk−z−g(znk)−g(z)znk−z∣+∣gnk(wnk)−gnk(z)wnk−z−g(wnk)−g(z)wnk−z∣+∣g(znk)−g(z)znk−z−g(wnk)−g(z)wnk−z∣(triangle inequality)≤2ε+∣g(znk)−g(z)znk−z−g′(z)∣+∣g(wnk)−g(z)wnk−z−g′(z)∣(by (3) and the triangle inequality)≤4ε.(by (2))\begin{aligned} \abs{\frac{F\p{z_{n_k}} - F\p{z}}{z_{n_k} - z} - \frac{F\p{w_{n_k}} - F\p{z}}{w_{n_k} - z}} &= \abs{\frac{g_{n_k}\p{z_{n_k}} - g_{n_k}\p{z}}{z_{n_k} - z} - \frac{g_{n_k}\p{w_{n_k}} - g_{n_k}\p{z}}{w_{n_k} - z}} && (\text{by (1)}) \\ &\leq \abs{\frac{g_{n_k}\p{z_{n_k}} - g_{n_k}\p{z}}{z_{n_k} - z} - \frac{g\p{z_{n_k}} - g\p{z}}{z_{n_k} - z}} + \abs{\frac{g_{n_k}\p{w_{n_k}} - g_{n_k}\p{z}}{w_{n_k} - z} - \frac{g\p{w_{n_k}} - g\p{z}}{w_{n_k} - z}} + \abs{\frac{g\p{z_{n_k}} - g\p{z}}{z_{n_k} - z} - \frac{g\p{w_{n_k}} - g\p{z}}{w_{n_k} - z}} && (\text{triangle inequality}) \\ &\leq 2\epsilon + \abs{\frac{g\p{z_{n_k}} - g\p{z}}{z_{n_k} - z} - g'\p{z}} + \abs{\frac{g\p{w_{n_k}} - g\p{z}}{w_{n_k} - z} - g'\p{z}} && (\text{by (3) and the triangle inequality}) \\ &\leq 4\epsilon. && (\text{by (2)}) \end{aligned}∣∣​znk​​−zF(znk​​)−F(z)​−wnk​​−zF(wnk​​)−F(z)​∣∣​​=∣∣​znk​​−zgnk​​(znk​​)−gnk​​(z)​−wnk​​−zgnk​​(wnk​​)−gnk​​(z)​∣∣​≤∣∣​znk​​−zgnk​​(znk​​)−gnk​​(z)​−znk​​−zg(znk​​)−g(z)​∣∣​+∣∣​wnk​​−zgnk​​(wnk​​)−gnk​​(z)​−wnk​​−zg(wnk​​)−g(z)​∣∣​+∣∣​znk​​−zg(znk​​)−g(z)​−wnk​​−zg(wnk​​)−g(z)​∣∣​≤2ε+∣∣​znk​​−zg(znk​​)−g(z)​−g′(z)∣∣​+∣∣​wnk​​−zg(wnk​​)−g(z)​−g′(z)∣∣​≤4ε.​​(by (1))(triangle inequality)(by (3) and the triangle inequality)(by (2))​

Thus, because {F(zn)−F(z)zn−z}n\set{\frac{F\p{z_n} - F\p{z}}{z_n - z}}_n{zn​−zF(zn​)−F(z)​}n​ and {F(wn)−F(z)wn−z}n\set{\frac{F\p{w_n} - F\p{z}}{w_n - z}}_n{wn​−zF(wn​)−F(z)​}n​ were both convergent and we found subsequences which converge to the same limit, it follows that both sequences converge to the same limit as well. Call this limit F′(z)F'\p{z}F′(z).

Now let {zn}n⊆D∖{z}\set{z_n}_n \subseteq \D \setminus \set{z}{zn​}n​⊆D∖{z} be any sequence which converges to zzz. As before, {F(zn)−F(z)zn−z}n\set{\frac{F\p{z_n} - F\p{z}}{z_n - z}}_n{zn​−zF(zn​)−F(z)​}n​ is bounded above. Let {znk}k\set{z_{n_k}}_k{znk​​}k​ be any subsequence, and by boundedness, it admits a further subsequence which converges. By our previous argument, this subsequence must be equal to F′(z)F'\p{z}F′(z). We have shown that any subsequence of {F(zn)−F(z)zn−z}n\set{\frac{F\p{z_n} - F\p{z}}{z_n - z}}_n{zn​−zF(zn​)−F(z)​}n​ has a further subsequence which converges to F′(z)F'\p{z}F′(z), and so

lim⁡n→∞F(zn)−F(z)zn−z=F′(z).\lim_{n\to\infty} \frac{F\p{z_n} - F\p{z}}{z_n - z} = F'\p{z}.n→∞lim​zn​−zF(zn​)−F(z)​=F′(z).

Thus, as our choice of {zn}n\set{z_n}_n{zn​}n​ was arbitrary, it follows that

lim⁡w→z;w≠zF(w)−F(z)w−z=F′(z),\lim_{w \to z; w \neq z} \frac{F\p{w} - F\p{z}}{w - z} = F'\p{z},w→z;w=zlim​w−zF(w)−F(z)​=F′(z),

so FFF is analytic at zzz. Finally, our choice of z∈Dz \in \Dz∈D was also arbitrary, so FFF is analytic on all of D\DD, which completes the proof.
